title: I think this is why Zed doesn't get nerfed.
body:
While watching a video on youtube, someone said in the comments something that explains most Zed players.

"Look at the ffcking retarded item (zhonyas)...it would have been an easy kill, but the zhonyas is so long ahri just needs to press it and has not to think about when she caan avoid the most dmgï»¿"

Did he really just say that Zed would have gotten a kill if his enemy mid laner didn't spend 3k gold on a zhonyas? If a champion gets a kill EVERY 90 SECONDS, unless his enemy rushes one of the most expensive items in the game, you know thats too much.
Balance zed, the only people that defend him are the ones that are still trying to grab freelo.

With the logic that there is an item that can help survive from zed, there's people thinking that zed is balanced, and boy oh boy, are they wrong. 

Riot you really need to nerf zed, increase his ults cooldown or give it a timer so he cant ult back out immediately.

replies.body: Lol. Most zed players just say Oh they got that item. Cool. Let me roam for my kills. No issue here. The idea that one item will prevent a zed from owning is just so funny.
I didn't know that the remaining champion roster was disallowed from roaming...

With this logic maybe we should nerf talon for his combo on the adc, and syndra, for her ult 100-0 the enemy midlaner, or even kha'zix i mean if u get isolated your dead, i mean come on yeah, zed is strong, but hes not any stronger then other midlaners, learn his kit and youll see theres plenty of counterplay. during teamfights cc him during his ult and you can burst him down before he can even kill the support, i played a game against a 9-2 zed as ryze and during team fights id snare him when he went for our adc, and we just focused him down and went on to win the game.

When Talon combos, he has no way of getting out. He burns all of his spells just to get in, while Zed can simply ult back out.
Syndra has no mobility, while zed has two mobility spells. Her ult cant even 100-0 the enemy midlaner unless she had a level lead along with a couple items.
Kha'Zix can be 1v1d in some cases if you get close to minions or use a pink ward to stop his passive, he's kiteable once he jumps. His mobility that comes with his E only allows him to get out ONCE he gets a kill, and actually shows him moving in the air, its not instant like Zed's.

Literally every game I've ever played as Nasus, I've seen a max of 800 stacks since nearly every game ends in under a half hour. Once you have 500, you push down towers in 3 Qs (works out to just over 6 seconds, and you can tank the tower damage in that time without issue, using the minion wave between that and the next to Q regen)

That makes you a giant threat to backdoor, meaning enemy sends 2-3 to you, leaving a 4 vs 2-3 scenario for your teamfight, makes it an easy win.
Well, alright then. Revert 3.13 Zed changes?
Who's Ryze?
xD

You can also get a QSS to remove Zed's R, which is a good chunk of his damage. AP has Zhonya's, AD has QSS.

Edit: Also. Zed can't 100-0 anyone who gets early armor until he has at least 2 or 3 items. If he's level 6 and you're level 6, you can't be 100-0'd unless you let him stand there and AA you and land extra E's and Q's. Zed isn't a problem until late game when he R's, Q's, and E's, then teleports back to his R's shadow and gets away, which is countered by a Zhonya's or QSS/Scimitar.

Fizz is way more broken than zed, lol no champ should be able to shred tanks and squishies the same late game like fizz

You mean like how Zed can? Remember, his ult amplifies all magic and physical damage, and he always builds heavy armor penetration, and usually (if he's smart) will BOTRK/Youmuu's active and AA during his ultimate. He doesn't seem to have difficulty killing tanks either, though it's a dumb Zed who focuses tanks.

If you come up against a Zed, just pick a champion that can block, displace, or interrupt Zed. Due to his insanely high skill-cap, its not very common you come up against a Faker-Zed. Zed has plenty of counterplay, quit bitching.
